title-part.text: ARRANGEMENT OR MOUNTING OF PROPULSION UNITS OR OF TRANSMISSIONS IN VEHICLES
ARRANGEMENT OR MOUNTING OF PLURAL DIVERSE PRIME-MOVERS
ARRANGEMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH COOLING, AIR INTAKE, GAS EXHAUST, OR FUEL SUPPLY, OF PROPULSION UNITS, IN VEHICLES

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated:
- "conjoint control of drive units" includes such control for
vehicles or of general applicability;
- "auxiliary drives" means drives of auxiliary or external
machines or devices from the propulsion unit, transmission,
or other parts of the vehicle, and includes the control of
such drives;
- "transmission" means all propulsion parts linking propulsion
units, e.g. engines, to ultimate propulsive elements, e.g.
wheels;
- "drive unit" means propulsion unit conjoint with transmission,
a "drive unit" can additionally include the ultimate driven
unit;
- "sub-unit" means, e.g. propulsion unit, clutch, gearing or
brake system;
- "hybrid vehicle" means vehicles with plural diverse
prime-movers for mutual or common propulsion
Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of class B60

CPC-specific-text.text: Informative references: mechanical gearings with secondary electric driveF16H3/72; arrangements for handling mechanical energy structurally associated with the dynamo-electric machine H02K7/00; machines comprising structurally interrelated motor and generator parts H02K51/00; dynamo-electric machines not otherwise provided for in H02K see H02K57/00

note.note-paragraph:
In this subgroup, the following expressions are used, with the meanings indicated :
- "energy storing means" means apparatus for storing propulsive
energy and providing stored energy to drive the prime mover or
the ultimate propulsive elements
- "hybrid electric vehicle" (HEV) means a vehicle with an
electrical prime mover and a combustion engine, in which the
electrical prime mover and the combustion engine either singly
or in combination, drive the ultimate propulsive elements, e.g.
wheels
- "motor-generator" means an electric motor, or an electric
generator, or an electrical machine which can be used for both
functions, as a motor or a generator
- "prime mover" means a propulsion unit or source of motive
power providing a mechanical output, e.g. via a rotating shaft

note.note-paragraph:
In this group:
- the means ordinarily includes a device, e.g. a servomechanism,
for operating a velocity-affecting element of the vehicle,
e.g. the throttle;
- a means for preventing a vehicle from exceeding a particular
speed is often referred to as a "governor", whereas a means
for maintaining the vehicle within a relatively narrow speed
range is generally designated as "speed control". Since these
two functions are frequently interrelated, no attempt has been
made to identify such means as being particularly adapted to
perform only one, or the other of the functions.

note.note-paragraph: The control of a single sub-unit is classified in the relevant class for the sub-unit. Where a single sub-unit is controlled by means of signals or commands from other sub-units the control of this single sub-unit is classified in the relevant class for this sub-unit. For instance, the control of variable-ratio gearing by means of signals from the engine or from another sub-unit influenced by the accelerator is classified in subclass F16H

Conjoint control of drive units, e.g. propulsion units, and variable-ratio gearing occuring only transiently during ratio shift and being also characterised by the control of the gearing is classified in subclass F16H

This group and its subgroups are no longer used for the classification of new documents as from January 1st, 2006. The backlog of thse groups is being continuosly reclassified to the relevant groups of B60W.

note.note-paragraph:
In this subgroup, the following expressions are used, with the meanings indicated :
- "energy storing means" means apparatus for storing propulsive
energy and providing stored energy to drive the prime mover or
the ultimate propulsive elements
- "hybrid electric vehicle" (HEV) means a vehicle with an
electrical prime mover and a combustion engine, in which the
electrical prime mover and the combustion engine either singly
or in combination, drive the ultimate propulsive elements, e.g.
wheels
- "motor-generator" means an electric motor, or an electric
generator, or an electrical machine which can be used for both
functions, as a motor or a generator
- "prime mover" means a propulsion unit or source of motive
power providing a mechanical output, e.g. via a rotating shaft

reference.text: fittings acting on two or more sub-units B60W30/14; propulsion unit control in general, see the relevant classes or subclasses, e.g. F02D; speedometers G01P; systems or devices for controlling speed in general G05D13/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: in traffic anti-collision system for road vehicles G08G1/16

note.note-paragraph:
In this group:
- the means ordinarily includes a device, e.g. a servomechanism,
for operating a velocity-affecting element of the vehicle,
e.g. the throttle;
- a means for preventing a vehicle from exceeding a particular
speed is often referred to as a "governor", whereas a means
for maintaining the vehicle within a relatively narrow speed
range is generally designated as "speed control". Since these
two functions are frequently interrelated, no attempt has been
made to identify such means as being particularly adapted to
perform only one, or the other of the functions.

CPC-specific-text.text: including means for detecting potential obstacles in vehicle path

title-part.text: Detecting position of target vehicle, e.g. vehicle driving ahead from host vehicle
Detecting longitudinal speed or acceleration of target vehicle
Detecting lateral speed of target vehicle
Selecting more than one target vehicle, e.g. using several preceding vehicles as target
Arrangements, adaptations or methods for cruise controls
Operator actuated switches or levers for cruise control or speed limiting systems
setting initial target speed, e.g. initial algorithms
changing target speed or setting a new target speed, e.g. changing algorithms
releasing speed control, e.g. inhibiting speed control if a brake pedal is depressed
resuming speed control, e.g. returning to old target speed
Distance setting methods, e.g. determining target distance to target vehicle
setting initial distance to preceding vehicle, e.g. initial algorithms
changing distance, e.g. reducing the distance for overtaking
releasing distance control, e.g. inhibiting control if target vehicle lost or changing lane
resuming distance control, e.g. changing target vehicle
Following time setting methods, e.g. elapsed delay between preceding and host vehicle
Mode switching, e.g. changing from one cruise control mode to another
Arrangement or mounting of propulsion units in vehicles

without preselection system, the control being mechanical
with preselection system, e.g. for semi-autonmatic transmission

the sub-units being engine, clutch and gearing
